title: High Education Expenditure
description: In 2021, Micronesia allocated 23.63% of its Gross National Income (GNI) to education, showcasing a strong commitment to educational development.

title: Low Mortality from Road Traffic Injuries
description: With a mortality rate of 0.2 per 100,000 population in 2019, Micronesia has one of the lowest road traffic injury rates globally.

title: High External Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 77.25% of Micronesia's current health expenditure was funded externally, indicating a heavy reliance on foreign aid for healthcare.

title: Minimal Terrestrial Protected Areas
description: As of 2018, only 0.05% of Micronesia's total land area was designated as protected, highlighting a potential area for environmental improvement.

title: Limited Mobile Cellular Subscriptions
description: In 2021, there were only 19.45 mobile cellular subscriptions per 100 people in Micronesia, indicating limited mobile connectivity.

title: Low Manufacturing Value Added
description: In 2023, the manufacturing sector contributed only $2,264,200 in current US dollars, reflecting a small manufacturing base.

title: Minimal Merchandise Exports to MENA
description: In 2021, exports to low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa constituted a negligible 0.00001% of total merchandise exports.
